page.title: 20The Fish_Farm at Kylesku.
page.content: With the opening of the Kylesku Bridge and the loss of ferry employment, the new fish farm which started at Kylesku in March 1985 was very welcome. At the start, the work was centred at Ullapool where sections of the 'pens' were made. At Kylestrome, they were asssembled into floatation units which were then towed up the loch and nets attached. Smolts (fish about one year old and weighing about 150g) were put into the floating pens. When the salmon mature in one or two years,they will be sold. At present, only four people are employed but once the fish farm is established, it is hoped more workers will be required. ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS: Compiled by Anita Brauer, Iain and Jane Clark, Ruairi and Magnus MacAulay, pupils at Unapool Primary School, June 1985
